description:
If there is no vaild host. rebuild VMs. the status of objects.Migration is 'accepted'.it should be "failed".

objects.Migration is created in nova.api. it's initial status should be 'accepted'
In nova.conductor, When occurrence NoValidHost or UnsupportedPolicyException,  there's nothing to do about Migration .
title: objects.Migration's status is 'accepted', when vm rebuild failed

comments.content:
If there is no vaild host. rebuild VMs. the status of objects.Migration is 'accepted'.it should be "failed".

objects.Migration is created in nova.api. it's initial status should be 'accepted'
In nova.conductor, When occurrence NoValidHost or UnsupportedPolicyException,  there's nothing to do about Migration .
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bailin-zhang

comments.content:
Change abandoned by Michael Still (<email address hidden>) on branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/348111
Reason: This patch has been sitting unchanged for more than 12 weeks. I am therefore going to abandon it to keep the review queue sane. Please feel free to restore the change if you're still working on it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
There are no currently open reviews on this bug, changing
the status back to the previous state and unassigning. If
there are active reviews related to this bug, please include
links in comments.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: In looking at the patch it seems like there was disagreements on the path forward. Can you confirm if this is still a proper bug given that feedback.

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
